Yes, this StackOverflow - anyhow taking the solution via JavaScript from Stack Overflow (if one satisfies the CORS restrictions) works apparently!

AI (or machine statistics as it might be better termed)

Large language models can seem to have near human performance but carefully eliminating statistical cues in the dataset shows they have no real conceptual understanding - achieving performance equivalent to random chance (this serious citation is reference 93 on the Stochastic Parrots paper). While all this code and statistical models can be useful (e.g. in machine translation) they can also be funny:-

https://kingjamesprogramming.tumblr.com/ is announced as the selected outputs of a Markov chain trained on the King James Bible and a few books by programming types.

To people raised in Christian or Anglo-American environments the King James Bible may have a familiar feel lending itself to this kind of humour. Adam Gopnik in a New Yorker piece on Abraham Lincoln argued Lincoln mastered the feel of the King James Bible - giving him the ability to make abstract issues sound like religious necessities. Terry Pratchett in Truckers uses the Biblical structure to great effect for The Book of Nome containing the commandments of Arnold Bros. (est 1905). So King James Programming is niche but sits in solid tradition - humourous or not.

This is not from a comedian‚Äôs account:

Love watching cricket and an ad comes on for Google Assistant which includes someone asking Google to put on Stranger Things, and then the TV you‚Äôre watching it on assumes that‚Äôs a real command and puts on Stranger Things.

‚Äî Matt Bevan (@MatthewBevan) December 27, 2021</blockquote>

- It was developed very quickly
- We don't know its long-term side effects
- It is not FDA approved
